title: FireFox taking lots of CPU and moderate lag (not just typing)
content:
I have tried fixing the config settings, I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling. I don't have any applications anymore (not even a background), and I have deleted and got rid of cache, history, etc.

But it still keeps lagging for me to the point that its hard to even use it now. I checked the task manager and even with just 1 new tab open, it was using 80% CPU. I changed the settings on it for the hardware like other replies said to do, and it still won't stop lagging.

It works perfectly in troubleshoot mode, but as soon as its gone, even when all the extensions and add-ons are removed, there's still a ton of lag. My computer is an Acer Nitro 5, I literally got it last year. Firefox was working up until 2 days ago just fine!

I can't seem to figure out the cause of it
creator: bitterstrawberries211

title: Parts of the UI Don't Scale on High DPI (Password/Bookmark/similar)
content:
I have a 43" 4k monitor. The only way to get this little pop-up interface (that shows when you are prompted to save a password or create a bookmark for example) to scale is to tell Windows to override High DPI scaling settings and use "System" or "System (Enhanced)" for Firefox.

However, this makes everything including both Firefox's UI and websites blurry.

The second image shows text when this System scaling is active. The third image shows text without any scaling overrides.

title: https

I frequently get: "You’ve enabled HTTPS-Only Mode for enhanced security, and a HTTPS version of www.software995.net is not available." yet when I select "Continue to the http site" it opens https://www.software995.net/bin/pdf995s.exe Firefox Developer edition 113.0b9 goes directly to the page unless in private mode in which case it reports a self signed certificate. This has yet to be an insurmountable problem but I expect someone will be interested.

title: Connection Error
content:
I am getting VERY frequently the error message: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR when I start up Firefox. It does go away if I close the browser and start it up again within a few moments. But If I let the computer sit without using the browser, it comes back. Went through all of the steps mentioned in a solution on this board to correct this...STILL doing it. I have the most recent version of Firefox, so that's not the issue. My internet connection is very strong (both the router and computer are in the same room, pretty much side by side)and I've tried to connect both with and without my VPN but still have the same issue.

I have lived with Firefox as my only browser since about the late 1990's but may have to switch if this issue can't be resolved. Yes, it's minor but it's still an annoyance to deal with.

I have attached a screenshot of the error that's constantly coming up when I start Firefox.

title: The shortcut for opening a new private window doesn't work when using "LeftCtrl + LeftShift + P"
content:
Using either of the modifier keys with their copies on the right side of the keyboard works. I can use any of the keys for other uses or shortcuts as well, for example, I can open the add-on manager using "LeftCtrl + LeftShift + A".

I have tried running Firefox in troubleshooting mode, have tried changing my keyboard locale (to Turkish, English-UK and Japanese) and have closed all running foreground processes before attempting it. I have asked several friends to test it out as well, it worked fine for them.

I don't even believe there's a difference between the left and right modifier keys. I've thought about it being a mechanical issue but both keys seem to work fine. My best bet was another app interfering, but I don't know what could be causing it. I have tried stopping the AMD Radeon Software's various processes as they were the ones I was most suspicious about, but it still does not work.

I would appreciate any ideas for addressing this. Thank you.
creator: Nyokko

title: What fields do these areas correspond to in Firefox Color?
content:

TIA!

creator: susankissinger

title: Consumo excesivo de procesador
content:
Buenas noches equipo de Firefox

Deseo comunicarles que tengo problemas de rendimiento en Windows 11 con Firefox respecto a Microsoft Edge.

El navegador en ocasiones consume recursos de manera excesiva cuando se navega. Para que se hagan una idea, los recursos del procesador en el Administrador de Tareas marca un 20%, al momento de usar Firefox, tiene picos de 85%, incluso del 100% (estadísticas que no tenía anteriormente)

Notifico esto ya que este navegador lo utilizo cotidianamente en el trabajo, estudio y a nivel personal. No me gustaría cambiar a los otros navegadores, pero si esto continúa afectándome, me tocará migrar a las alternativas.

Espero su pronta respuesta.

Muchas gracias
creator: gusta2715p

title: Firefox usually doesn't launch except at night. Why??
content: I've had Firefox issues for months now. It started after the update three updates ago. Firefox would take 10-15 minutes to load, I often couldn't load websites even after it had loaded....except for a couple of nights recently I've been able to use it flawlessly. Like right now. It's almost 11pm and it's working. I've been through the clear the cache, check if the extensions are slowing it down etc. routine. So why is it working now? It probably won't work in the morning, it didn't work last night, but it worked a few nights ago and again tonight. I'm sorry this sounds so strange but I don't know what to do. I've had to use a different browser for a while but would love to come back to Firefox again.

title: How to enable a Real Search Box in the middle of a New Tab Page
content:
In the middle of the FF home page, the search box functions normally, but not on a new tab page. The box is fake and typing automatically goes to the address bar. I changed the setting in about:preferences#search to "Add search bar in toolbar." That resulted in adding a 2" search bar to the right of the address bar with a TINY font. VERY difficult to see.

Next in about:config, I switched this to false: "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.improvesearch.handoffToAwesomebar ". But, that didn't fix it.

An article on askvg.com said to do the above, but to do it in FF's NIGHTLY. To get the search box to function in the center of the page, will I have to install Firefox Nightly alongside my normal Firefox Release and fix it there? Then will it sync over to my regular FF and fix it? Or, is there another way?
creator: xxq107a

title: Issues accessing some websites

title: I don't know the proper terminology for the things diplayed on the Firefox home page.
content: I would like to find an image of the computer screen that appears when I log on to Firefox with the toolbars, etc. labeled. I can't ask an intelligent question because I can't describe what I want. I have two Firefox images on the bottom of my computer screen. When I click on one of them, the eight websites that I go to most frequently appear in the center of the computer screen. However, when I click on any of them, nothing happens. If I click on the other Firefox image, there are seven websites displayed and only one is a frequently visited site. How can I activate the first site where my frequently viewed sites are found. Or, how can I edit the second site to populate it with sites I visit? On the second Firefox site, there is a item on the top tool bar, or whatever it is called, that is titled "Most Visited". It displays three sites, but multiple times for each. How can I edit that listing to include several sites I frequent?
